text:
*API List blog posts*
GET /content/api/v2/blog-posts

Objective : I want to get all posts published for the last 2 days
Problem : Apparently it's not possible to add "published_date" as a query parameter

How can I fix that ?

Hey <@U3TR96G84>, one way you could do this would be to use a couple query params, along with some scripting logic:
Your query would include `&state=PUBLISHED&order_by=publish_date`
When you're processing the posts returned to you, you would disregard posts with a `publish_date` greater than 2 days old.
Here's the doc with all the filters currently available <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/get_blog_posts>

Thanks but I have 6000 posts in our blog
I just want to get all posts from a specified publish_date

Strange to be able to filter with created, updated and deteled_at but not published_date for a blog post query

I'm working with the `blogs` API documented at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/get_blogs>. I'm having trouble accessing the topics on each blog post. Screenshot incoming. I can retrieve the IDs for the topics/tags, but I can't find the actual text of these tags. The arrays `tag_list`, `tag_names`, `topic_list` and `topic_names` are all empty. Am I misunderstanding something here? I have a meeting in a couple minutes and I'll be offline, but I'll be back on in a couple hours. Any insights are much appreciated. <@U6TBZ66FN> <@U22PKFRU5>
I have not used the API. But you may need to use those IDs to get the topics back: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blog/v3/get-blog-topic-by-id>
Yeah it does require a few extra steps to accomplish that particular goal.
<@UDHTE1Y1Z>, we have run into this issue as well, apparently HubSpot does not transform the IDs into Text labels, not ideal at all, would be so much more useful if it was a text label
(also check follow up posts in the main <#C2YHAHB6K|api> chat)

<@UF6M5BW4C>, so is this a bug? I know I can use the topics api and find the text for each topic id, but cross referencing that for our 326 blog posts isn't ideal. Is there anyone else on here that works for HubSpot? <@U6TBZ66FN> is the only one I know of. He's been super helpful in the past.

<@UDHTE1Y1Z> we ended up doing some sort of cross referencing, like literally loading all the topics in variable which then we can access along with apply the tag name as a div class name so we could get our filter working approrpriately
Ok. Thanks. I'll do it that way then.
Iâ€™m OOO today but maybe Derek has some thoughts?

Thanks! I actually hadn't noticed these responses on the thread until now (outside of the channel). I will use the topics API if I need to. It just seemed like a bug that these arrays were blank on the main blogs API, when by the IDs array there obviously are tags/topics on the posts.
